==Events==
*  [[37]] &ndash; [[Roman Emperor]] [[Caligula]] accepts the titles of the [[Principate]], entitled to him by the [[Senate]].
* [[193]] &ndash; Roman Emperor [[Pertinax]] is [[assassination|assassin]]ated by [[Praetorian Guard]]s, who then sell the throne in an [[auction]] to [[Didius Julianus]].
* [[364]] &ndash; Roman Emperor [[Valentinian I]] appoints his brother [[Valens|Flavius Valens]] co-[[emperor]].
* [[845]] &ndash; [[Paris]] is sacked by [[Viking]] raiders, probably under [[Ragnar Lodbrok]], who collects a huge ransom in exchange for leaving.
*[[1566]] &ndash; The foundation stone of [[Valletta]], [[Malta]]'s capital city, is laid by [[Jean Parisot de Valette]], [[List of Grand Masters of the Knights Hospitaller|Grand Master of the Sovereign Military Order of Malta]].
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[Juan Bautista de Anza]] finds the site for the [[Presidio of San Francisco]].
*[[1794]] &ndash; Allies under the [[prince]] of [[Saxe-Coburg-Gotha|Coburg]] defeat [[France|French]] forces at [[Le Cateau-Cambrésis|Le Cateau]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; [[Partitions of Poland]]: The [[Duchy of Courland and Semigallia]], a northern [[Fiefdom|fief]] of the [[Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth]], ceases to exist and becomes part of [[Imperial Russia]].
*[[1802]] &ndash; [[Heinrich Wilhelm Matthäus Olbers]] discovers [[2 Pallas]], the second [[asteroid]] known to man.
*[[1809]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: France defeats Spain in the [[Battle of Medelin]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: The [[Royal Navy]] of the [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|United Kingdom]] defeats de [[United States Navy]] in a [[Battle of Valparaiso|Battle]] off [[Valparaíso]], [[Chile]].
*[[1854]] &ndash; [[Crimean War]]: [[France]] and [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|Britain]] declare war on [[Russia]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; [[First Taranaki War]]: The Battle of Waireka begins.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Glorieta Pass]] &ndash; in [[New Mexico]], [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] forces stop the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] invasion of [[New Mexico]] territory. The battle began on [[March 26]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[Paris Commune]] is formally established in [[Paris]].
*[[1883]] &ndash; [[Tonkin Campaign]]: French victory in the [[Battle of Gia Cuc]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; The [[Yngsjö murder]] in [[Yngsjö]], [[Sweden]]: [[Anna Månsdotter]] is arrested along with her son.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Henri Fabre]] becomes the first person to fly a [[seaplane]], the [[Fabre Hydravion]], after taking off from a water runway near [[Martigues]], [[France]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Guatemala]] becomes a signatory to the [[Buenos Aires Convention|Buenos Aires copyright treaty]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Palm Sunday tornado outbreak of 1920]] affects the [[Great Lakes]] region and [[Deep South]] states.
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Constantinople]] and [[Ankara|Angora]] change their names to [[Istanbul]] and [[Ankara]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; The [[Imperial Airways]] biplane ''City of Liverpool'' is believed to be the first airline lost to [[sabotage]] when a passenger [[1933 Imperial Airways Dixmude crash|sets a fire on board]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[Spanish Civil War]]: [[Generalissimo]] [[Francisco Franco]] conquers [[Madrid]] after [[Siege of Madrid|a three-year siege]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Battle of Cape Matapan]] &ndash; in the [[Mediterranean Sea]], [[United Kingdom|British]] [[Admiral]] [[Andrew Browne Cunningham]] leads the [[Royal Navy]] in the destruction of three major [[Italy|Italian]] heavy cruisers and two destroyers.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[St Nazaire Raid]]:  In occupied [[France]], [[United Kingdom|British]] naval forces successfully [[St Nazaire Raid|raid]] the [[Germany|German]]-occupied port of [[St. Nazaire]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: The [[United States State Department]] releases the [[Acheson–Lilienthal Report]], outlining a plan for the international control of [[nuclear power]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; [[First Indochina War]]: In the [[Battle of Mao Khe]], [[French Union]] forces, led by World War II hero [[Jean de Lattre de Tassigny]], inflict a defeat on [[Việt Minh]] forces commanded by General [[Võ Nguyên Giáp]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; The [[State Council of the People's Republic of China]] dissolves the [[Government of Tibet]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; Brazilian high school student [[Edson Luís de Lima Souto]] is shot by the police in a protest for cheaper meals at a restaurant for low-income students. The aftermath of his death is one of the first major events against the military dictatorship.
*[[1969]] &ndash; Greek poet and [[Nobel Prize]] laureate [[Giorgos Seferis]] makes a famous statement on the [[BBC World Service]] opposing the junta in [[Greece]].
*  1969   &ndash; The [[McGill University|McGill]] français movement [[protest]] occurs, the second largest protest in Montreal's history with 10,000 [[trade unionists]], leftist activists, [[College education in Quebec|college]] students, and some McGill students at McGill's [[Roddick Gates]]. The majority of the protesters are arrested.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[1970 Gediz earthquake|Gediz earthquake]]: A 7.2 [[Moment magnitude scale|magnitude]] earthquake strikes western [[Turkey]] at about 23:05 local time, killed 1,086 and injured 1,260.
*[[1978]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|US Supreme Court]] hands down 5–3 decision in ''[[Stump v. Sparkman]]'', 435 U.S. 349, a controversial case involving involuntary [[Human sterilization|sterilization]] and [[judicial immunity]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; A coolant leak at the [[Three Mile Island]]'s Unit 2 [[nuclear reactor]] outside [[Harrisburg, Pennsylvania]] leads to the core overheating and a partial melt down.
*  1979   &ndash; The [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]] passes a [[1979 vote of no confidence against the government of James Callaghan|vote of no confidence]] against [[James Callaghan]]'s government, precipitating a [[United Kingdom general election, 1979|general election]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[George H. W. Bush]] posthumously awards [[Jesse Owens]] the [[Congressional Gold Medal]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; In South Africa, [[Zulus]] and [[African National Congress]] supporters battle in central [[Johannesburg]], resulting in 18 deaths.
*  1994   &ndash; [[BBC Radio 5 (former)|BBC Radio 5]] is closed and replaced with a new news and sport station [[BBC Radio 5 Live]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Kosovo War]]: [[Serb paramilitary]] and military forces kill 146 [[Kosovo Albanians]] in the [[Izbica massacre]].
*[[2000]] &ndash; Three children are killed when a [[Murray County, Georgia]], school bus is hit by a [[CSX]] freight train.
*[[2003]] &ndash; In a [[friendly fire]] incident, two [[A-10 Thunderbolt II]] attack aircraft from the [[United States]] [[Idaho Air National Guard]]'s [[190th Fighter Squadron]] [[190th Fighter Squadron, Blues and Royals friendly fire incident|attack]] [[Great Britain|British]] tanks participating in the [[2003 invasion of Iraq]], killing British soldier Matty Hull.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[2005 Sumatra earthquake]] rocks [[Indonesia]], and at magnitude 8.7 is the fourth strongest earthquake since [[1965]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; At least one million union members, students, and unemployed take to the streets in [[France]] in protest at the government's proposed [[First Employment Contract]] law.
